intro: Cirsium barduanum, commonly known as Barduan's thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. It has a robust root system that helps it survive in harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
